body.p: Other than shutting down eclimd, you should seldom need to use the eclim command line client directly. However it can be useful when troubleshooting issues or developing your own enhancements.
You can find the eclim command line client in $ECLIPSE_HOME/plugins/org.eclim_version/bin.
The general format for using the command line clients is

section.title: Help
section.source:
usage: eclim [-port port] [-filter filter] -command command [command options] [command args] eclim -?/--help for more information -?,--help Print full usage information. -command <command> The command to execute. -filter <filter> Xml output is processed by the corresponding filter type if it exists. -port <port> The server port.
Command Args -----------------
ping No args. shutdown No args. java_search (-f/--file <file> -o/--offset <offset> -l/--length <length> | -p/--pattern <pattern> -t/--type <type>) -x/--context <context> [-s/--scope <scope>] -f/-file <file> The file where the search is originating from. -o/--offset <offset> The character offet in the file where the search is orignating from. -l/--length <offset> The length of the current element in the file where the search is originating from. -p/--pattern <pattern> Pattern to search for. -t/--type <type> The type of element to search for, where the possible types are: [all|annotation|class|classOrEnum|classOrInterface| constructor|enum|field|interface|method|package|type] -x/--context <context> The context of the search, where the possible contexts include: [all|declarations|implementors|references] -s/--scope <scope> Not currently used. The scope of the search, where the possible scopes include: [file|hierarchy|project|workspace] java_import -p/--pattern <pattern> [-t/--type <type>] [-s/--scope <scope>] -p/--pattern <pattern> Element to import (typically a class name). -t/--type <type> Not currently used (will be specific to JSE 1.5) -s/--scope <scope> Not currently used. The scope of the search, where the possible scopes include: [file|hierarchy|project|workspace] java_complete -f/--file <file> -o/--offset <offset> -f/--file <file> The file to request code completion for. -o/--offset <offset> The character offset in the file. java_src_update -p/--project <project> [-f/--file <file>] -p/--project <project> The name of the project containing the src file. -f/--file <file> The path to the file to update (relative to the file's src dir. project_create -f/--folder <folder> [-d/--depends <depends>] -f/--folder <folder> The base folder to create the project from. -d/--depends <depends> Comma separated list of other projects this project depends on. project_update -n/--name <name> -n/--name <name> The name of the project to update.
